Reason: The _journalSizeThreshold configuration is performance-sensitive because it directly affects the size threshold for the journal storage in the PersistentJournal. This configuration impacts the memory consumption and efficiency of the journal storage system. Setting a higher threshold may lead to increased memory usage and potentially slower performance due to larger data storage, while setting a lower threshold may result in more frequent archiving or clearing of journal data, impacting the execution time of the system. Therefore, the _journalSizeThreshold configuration can cause notable performance variations at the system level.
